title: Does the song ' Yellow Submarine' by The Beatles carry a deeper meaning? - Quora

response.answer_text: No, Paul said the song just came to him at night when he was in bed. “When silly songs come to you.” He wanted to write a song for Ringo, a children’s song, and that’s what he did. It just is what it is. It’s one of those songs some Beatles fans dislike because of it’s nature. I love it, I love that side of The Beatles that could just knock off something like this and it’s all fun and then becomes an animated film. I’ve always wondered if there is a demo of it in the vaults with Paul on vocals. Maybe just him and an acoustic guitar. I’d love to hear it. Michael Jackson was going to make a sequel at one time and there was going to be a CGI remake. In the Museum of Liverpool in Liverpool, you can go in a pod a sing to a karaoke version of it. I remember that we used to sing it at school during music lessons, along with Lucy in the Sky with Diamonds.

Yellow Submarine is a song about a mariner who told a story to young kids about where he’d lived. The song began as being about different coloured submarines, but evolved to include only a yellow one. Source: Yellow Submarine (song) - Wikipedia
